title: Beyond Test Scores: How Academic Rank Shapes Long-Term OutcomesWe are grateful to Massimiliano Bratti, Margherita Fort, Rigissa Megalokonomou, Birgitta Rabe, Daniela Sonedda, and especially Emma Duchini and Ingo Isphording for the precious feedback and suggestions provided on this study. We also appreciate the constructive comments from participants at the 2024 Workshop in Economics of Education and Policy (WEEP), the 2024 EEA-ESEM Conference, and seminar attendees at ISER, Curtin University, and Monash University. We thank Heather Clark (University of Aberdeen) and the team at the Grampian Data Safe Haven (DaSH) for their assistance with data access and management. The findings and opinions expressed in this paper are solely our own and do not necessarily reflect those of DaSH or the University of Aberdeen. We acknowledge funding from the ESRC Research Centre on Micro-Social Change (MiSoC), award number ES/S012486/1. This paper also benefited from the use of OpenAI’s ChatGPT for brainstorming, drafting, and writing assistance.
